text: Jamal Lasri (in Arabic: جمال العسري; born 6 September 1973) is a Moroccan- Portuguese synthetic chemist.ORCIDJamal Lasri profile and metrics He obtained his Ph.D. degree in organic chemistry from the University of Valencia. He is currently a Full Professor at King Abdulaziz University.Webpage of Jamal Lasri at King Abdulaziz University Lasri and coworkers published the first example of oxadiazoline and/or ketoimine palladium(II) complexes as highly efficient catalysts for Suzuki reaction in supercritical carbon dioxide (scCO2) or in water.R. R. Fernandes, J. Lasri, M. F. C. Guedes da Silva, A. M. F. Palavra, J. A. L. da Silva, J. J. R. Fraústo da Silva, A. J. L. Pombeiro, Adv. Synth. Catal. 2011, 353, 1153. http://doi.org/10.1002/adsc.201000909J. Lasri, T. C. O. Mac Leod, A. J. L. Pombeiro, Appl. Catal. A: Gen. 2011, 397, 94. http://doi.org/10.1016/j.apcata.2011.02.019J. Lasri, M. F. C. Guedes da Silva, M. N. Kopylovich, S. Mukhopadhyay, M. A. Januário Charmier, A. J. L. Pombeiro, Dalton Trans. 2009, 2210. http://doi.org/10.1039/B813996BJ. Lasri, M. N. Kopylovich, M. F. C. Guedes da Silva, M. A. Januário Charmier, A. J. L. Pombeiro, Chem. -Eur. J. 2008, 14, 9312. http://doi.org/10.1002/chem.200800510 He also discovered the Lasri condensation, the organic reaction of chalcone with a hydrazone to produce an azine and 3,5-diphenyl-1H-pyrazole.Lasri condensationJ. Lasri, A. I. Ismail, Indian J. Chem. Sect.
